channel.title: [Project Insanity] 317 Interface on login. [first tut]
channel.description:
ever want to send a message to your server but dont want to use the regular [SERVER] messages? well this is how and it puts it right in their faces. litterally :P.
this is my first tut soo..flame hate like it love it. idc up to u guys. this is the most recent tut that i have found of this to work on the most updated 317 Project Insanity sources
this tut is going to walk u through how to make it to when people log in, it shows a customizable interface :D
STEP 1: first you wanna open up your client class (client.java) and search for [code=java] public class Client extends Player { [/code]
directly under that you'll want to add
[code=java] public void customInterface() { [/code]
STEP 2: now search for [code=java] public void initialize() { [/code] directly under that last bracket add [code=java] customInterface() { [/code]
doing this makes it to where when someone logs in, it will show the interface chosen.
STEP 3: the customizing go back up to where u added [code=java] public void customInterface() { [/code]
now heres the fun part. making your interface. as you know thoughout project insanity there are numerous different interfaces, im going to be using 3023 as an example, (to check your interfaces go in-game and use ::interface #### (#### being the interface number)
directly under the last bracket of [code=java] public void customInterface() { [/code]
add the interface you desire like so. [code=java] getPA().showInterface(3023); getPA().sendFrame126("Close Window", 3024);//Close Text getPA().sendFrame126("", 3026);//Line 1 getPA().sendFrame126("", 3027);//Line 2 getPA().sendFrame126("", 3028);//Line 3 getPA().sendFrame126("", 3029);//Line 4 getPA().sendFrame126("", 3030);//Line 5 getPA().sendFrame126("", 3031);//Line 6 getPA().sendFrame126("", 3032);//Line 7 getPA().sendFrame126("", 3033);//Line 8 getPA().sendFrame126("", 3034);//Line 9 getPA().sendFrame126("", 3035);//Line 10 getPA().sendFrame126("", 3036);//Line 11 getPA().sendFrame126("", 3037);//Line 12 flushOutStream(); } [/code] to change the interface just change where it says [code=java] getPA().showInterface(3023); [/code] to [code=java] getPA().showInterface(####); [/code] and also change the line numbers [code=java] getPA().sendFrame126("", ####);//Line 1 getPA().sendFrame126("", ####);//Line 2 getPA().sendFrame126("", ####);//Line 3 getPA().sendFrame126("", ####);//Line 4 getPA().sendFrame126("", ####);//Line 5 getPA().sendFrame126("", ####);//Line 6 getPA().sendFrame126("", ####);//Line 7 getPA().sendFrame126("", ####);//Line 8 getPA().sendFrame126("", ####);//Line 9 getPA().sendFrame126("", ####);//Line 10 getPA().sendFrame126("", ####);//Line 11 getPA().sendFrame126("", ####);//Line 12 [/code] in between the quotes you can add custom text to the interface..
if you did all this right, you should end up with something like showing to players when they log in,(this is the 3023 interface with my custom text)
[img]http://i1126.photobucket.com/albums/l609/xThaSceneKid/interface.jpg?t=1308601421[/img]
well there you have it. if you do decide to use it please comment, and post the different results that you come up with :D i'd love to see everyones different ideas.
enjoy your interface customizing :P

you can use any interface u want as long as you know the line numbers and the interface is actually added into your client and source

item.title: [Project Insanity] 317 Interface on login. [first tut]
item.dc:creator: @l0lc0pt3r l0lc0pt3r
item.description:
@l0lc0pt3r wrote:

ever want to send a message to your server but dont want to use the regular [SERVER] messages? well this is how and it puts it right in their faces. litterally :P.

this is my first tut soo…flame hate like it love it. idc up to u guys. this is the most recent tut that i have found of this to work on the most updated 317 Project Insanity sources

this tut is going to walk u through how to make it to when people log in, it shows a customizable interface

STEP 1:
first you wanna open up your client class (client.java) and search for

public class Client extends Player {

directly under that you’ll want to add

public void customInterface() {

STEP 2:
now search for

public void initialize() {

directly under that last bracket add

customInterface() {

doing this makes it to where when someone logs in, it will show the interface chosen.

STEP 3: the customizing
go back up to where u added

public void customInterface() {

now heres the fun part. making your interface. as you know thoughout project insanity there are numerous different interfaces, im going to be using 3023 as an example, (to check your interfaces go in-game and use ::interface #### (#### being the interface number)

directly under the last bracket of

public void customInterface() {

add the interface you desire like so.

getPA().showInterface(3023);
getPA().sendFrame126("Close Window", 3024);//Close Text
getPA().sendFrame126("", 3026);//Line 1
getPA().sendFrame126("", 3027);//Line 2
getPA().sendFrame126("", 3028);//Line 3
getPA().sendFrame126("", 3029);//Line 4
getPA().sendFrame126("", 3030);//Line 5
getPA().sendFrame126("", 3031);//Line 6
getPA().sendFrame126("", 3032);//Line 7
getPA().sendFrame126("", 3033);//Line 8
getPA().sendFrame126("", 3034);//Line 9
getPA().sendFrame126("", 3035);//Line 10
getPA().sendFrame126("", 3036);//Line 11
getPA().sendFrame126("", 3037);//Line 12
flushOutStream();
	}

to change the interface just change where it says

getPA().showInterface(3023);

to

getPA().showInterface(####);

and also change the line numbers

getPA().sendFrame126("", ####);//Line 1
getPA().sendFrame126("", ####);//Line 2
getPA().sendFrame126("", ####);//Line 3
getPA().sendFrame126("", ####);//Line 4
getPA().sendFrame126("", ####);//Line 5
getPA().sendFrame126("", ####);//Line 6
getPA().sendFrame126("", ####);//Line 7
getPA().sendFrame126("", ####);//Line 8
getPA().sendFrame126("", ####);//Line 9
getPA().sendFrame126("", ####);//Line 10
getPA().sendFrame126("", ####);//Line 11
getPA().sendFrame126("", ####);//Line 12

in between the quotes you can add custom text to the interface…

if you did all this right, you should end up with something like showing to players when they log in,(this is the 3023 interface with my custom text)

well there you have it. if you do decide to use it please comment, and post the different results that you come up with i’d love to see everyones different ideas.

enjoy your interface customizing

Read full topic
